question: What does Spotifriends do?
answer: Spotifriends allows people to create a shared music space, invite friends into that space and listen to a playlist of tracks synchronised across all their devices.

question: Can I use this app if I don't have Spotify Premium?
answer: No, unfortunately certain features of spotify are limited only to Premium users therefore this app is subject to those same limitations.

question: Can I use this app across many devices only using one account?
answer: This is largely blocked by spotify therefore this app works intentionally to block it too, allowing only one user to use one instance of this app. ( even multiple tabs on the same machine )

question: Is this app supported on any device with a web browser?
answer: Currently the spotify technologies the app relies on do not support all browsers and devices, currently only Chrome and Firefox are strongly supported.

question: Can I control this app from spotify?
answer: Currently this is in development but at the moment is largely blocked and if attempted will kick you to this page for clarification.

question: Why was I redirected to this page?
answer: This could have happened for a myriad of reasons but most likely because you tried to control spotifriends from a spotify app.

question: What's up with the volume?
answer: For reasons I haven't figured out yet, the volume is inconsistent across tracks, will hopefully fix soon.

question: Why build Spotifriends
answer: Due to the COVID-19 lockdown, I felt the need more and more to listen to music with friends, so I tried to solve that issue!
